body_html:
I'm also interested in this issue. Planning to upgrade my hardware for new RTX boards and CUDA 10. Would like to know if all this works properly. I know (not sure though) that to use Tensor core you need to train in FP16 end to end (but I know MaxPool3D is only FP32 which is very impactful on performance).

Found this, so it seems to work on RTX boards : https://www.pugetsystems.com/labs/hpc/NVIDIA-RTX-2080-Ti-vs-2080-vs-1080-Ti-vs-Titan-V-TensorFlow-Performance-with-CUDA-10-0-1247/

body:
I'm also interested in this issue. Planning to upgrade my hardware for new RTX boards and CUDA 10. Would like to know if all this works properly. I know (not sure though) that to use Tensor core you need to train in FP16 end to end (but I know MaxPool3D is only FP32 which is very impactful on performance).

Found this, so it seems to work on RTX boards : https://www.pugetsystems.com/labs/hpc/NVIDIA-RTX-2080-Ti-vs-2080-vs-1080-Ti-vs-Titan-V-TensorFlow-Performance-with-CUDA-10-0-1247/
